title: When to perform outbound calls?
intro: In addition to inbound service, Customer Service makes active contacts with customers, especially in promotional campaigns and actions related to the Group's Cards:

t1.title: 1. Card activation
t1.text: Contact customers to activate newly issued cards.

t2.title: 2. Registration update
t2.text: Keep customer data always up to date.

t3.title: 3. Promotion communication
t3.text: Inform about exclusive offers and benefits.

t4.title: 4. Cancellation reversal
t4.text: Work to retain customers who want to cancel services.

a1.l1: Organize and tabulate data, prepare reports and support team demands.
a1.l2: Act proactively in identifying improvements in scripts and service standards.
a1.l3: Contribute to the constant evolution of the service provided.

a2.text: Knowledge of responsibilities allows you to act with more confidence and assertiveness, contributing to your career evolution.

quiz.question: You notice that several customers call with the same question about a new promotion. What is the best attitude aligned with CS continuous improvement responsibilities?
quiz.opt_a: A) Continue serving each one individually without flagging the fact.
quiz.feedback_wrong_a: Continuing to serve individually does not solve the structural problem and maintains the volume of unnecessary calls.
quiz.opt_b: B) Complain to colleagues that customers don't know how to read the regulations.
quiz.feedback_wrong_b: Complaining is not productive and does not contribute to process improvement.
quiz.opt_c: C) Signal the observed pattern to the supervisor so that the promotion communication can be adjusted.
quiz.opt_d: D) Tell the customer to look for the information on the website.
quiz.feedback_wrong_d: Sending the customer to search for information alone demonstrates a lack of care and does not resolve the issue.
quiz.feedback: Correct Answer! Proactivity in identifying patterns helps improve the process for everyone.
